articles.author: Hadley Freeman
articles.title: ‘I could not get out of Britain fast enough’: Amanda de Cadenet on tabloid bullies, teenage fame and making it in the US - The Guardian
articles.description: She was dubbed ‘the wild child’ in the UK when she presented The Word in the early 90s – and left scarred by the experience. After fleeing across the Atlantic, she reinvented herself, as a feminist activist, photographer, talkshow host and now a podcaster

articles.title: George Ezra: End to End review – singer-songwriter’s charming cross-Britain hike - The Guardian
articles.description: After months of isolation and anxious about touring again, Ezra and two friends walk the length of the UK meeting musicians in an uplifting documentary
articles.content: George Ezras reputation as the nicest man in pop emerges intact from this easygoing documentary that follows his 95-day, 1,200 mile walk from Lands End to John oGroats. Striding out in box-fresh hiki… [+1883 chars]
